alert.note: Alert for Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 04 at 2:24AM MST until March 05 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT SUNDAY AFTERNOON FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20-FT WIND OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, AND HIGH TO VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO... CULBERSON COUNTY AND GAINES COUNTY... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT SUNDAY AFTERNOON FOR RELATIVE HUMIDITY OF 15% OR LESS, 20-FT WIND OF 20 MPH OR GREATER, AND HIGH TO VERY HIGH FIRE DANGER FOR SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO... CULBERSON COUNTY AND GAINES COUNTY... * AFFECTED AREA...Gaines, Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains, Chaves Plains, Eddy Plains, Lea, Guadalupe Mountains Above 7000 Feet, Guadalupe and Delaware Mountains, Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor and Eastern Culberson County. * TIMING...Sunday afternoon. * WINDS...Southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 7 percent. * RFTI...6 or 7, critical to extreme. * IMPACTS...Avoid the use of open flames or any activities that may generate sparks. Accidental ignitions may have the potential to grow into dangerous wind-driven wildfires. Ensure that chains attached to trailers will not touch the pavement, thereby eliminating the possibility to generate sparks.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Chaves County Plains; Eddy Plains; Lea; Sacramento Foothills and Guadalupe Mountains
